metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: Yuri is a 40-something man with salt-and-pepper hair, apparently of Russian origin, who works at or is associated with the brokerage firm. He is introduced in a disheveled and incapacitated state — face down at a desk with a wet pant leg — suggesting he had an accident (likely urinated on himself). Despite this, he is present at the VIP celebration later, where he is quiet, delayed in his reactions, and communicates minimally, primarily in Russian. He appears to have been instrumental in closing a significant deal ('Cane Deeds'), suggesting he holds a meaningful professional role despite his erratic personal state.
data.dialogue_summary: Yuri speaks only twice, both times in Russian. In the first scene, he mumbles 'Boobies' while grabbing at Greta's breasts as she helps him up. In the second scene, he responds 'Good!' with a thumbs up when Joaquin mocks him. His communication is minimal, delayed, and non-English, making him largely a visual and comedic presence rather than a verbal one.

explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. 2ND LEVEL TRADING PIT - DANTE'S DESK

explicit_evidence.quote: We see YURI, (40-something man with salt-and-pepper hair), at the desk beside, face down, and one pant leg wet on the inside.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. 2ND LEVEL TRADING PIT - DANTE'S DESK

explicit_evidence.quote: WE GOT CANE DEEDS! That's right my friend, we did it!

inferred_traits.rationale: Found face-down with a wet pant leg, requires a pill and water from Greta to be revived, and Joaquin jokes about his 'wet undies.' His delayed reactions and quiet demeanor at the VIP room further suggest ongoing intoxication or exhaustion from substance use.
Cassandra publicly credits him for closing the 'Cane Deeds' deal and celebrates him in front of the group, suggesting he is a productive and valued member of the team despite his personal state.
inferred_traits.trait: Respected within the firm despite personal struggles

inferred_traits.rationale: Yuri says almost nothing throughout both scenes, responds with thumbs up and delayed smiles, and allows Greta to handle him without resistance. He does not engage in the banter around him.
The script notes 'It looks like he has been up for days to help close this deal,' suggesting his disheveled state may be partly due to extreme work effort rather than purely substance abuse.
inferred_traits.value: Likely from overwork on the deal

data.name: YURI

relationships.evidence: Greta revives Yuri with a pill and water, helps him up, and takes him to get cleaned up, suggesting she regularly manages his incapacitated states.
Cassandra publicly credits Yuri for closing the 'Cane Deeds' deal and celebrates him in front of the group.
Joaquin mocks Yuri with nicknames like 'Yurine,' 'Yee,' and 'Pee,' and jokes about his wet undies, though without apparent malice.

scene_presence: INT. 2ND LEVEL TRADING PIT - DANTE'S DESK
